labels.text: This detail is suitable for use with corrugate and trapezoidal rib profiles.
Underlays, flashing tapes and window support bars to be in place.
Coordinate with builder for adequate framing to fasten to.
Cladding and flashings to be suitably separated from any timber.
Work from factory edges first.
Primary fasteners 30mm embedment minimum into primary framing.

Fit Base flashing behind battens and underlay, tab corner around to make safe.
Tape top of flashings where a Rigid Air Barrier is used.

Base flashing should not contact concrete, or use DPC to isolate if contact is unavoidable.

Underflashing laps over Base.
Fasten Underflashing using a clout, wafer screw or flashing clip.
Soffit flashing laps over Underflashing.
Optional compressible foam if specified.
Do not penetrate Underflashing with fastener.
Fold bottom of flashing to ensure vermin-proofing.
Fix Overflashing to cladding with rivet.
Increase depth of Soffit and Base flashings to fit past Box Corners.
This detail is suitable for use with corrugate and trapezoidal rib profiles.
Underlays, flashing tapes and window support bars to be in place.
Coordinate with builder for adequate framing to fasten to.
Cladding and flashings to be suitably separated from any timber.
Work from factory edges first.
Primary fasteners 30mm embedment minimum into primary framing.

Fit Base flashing behind battens and underlay, tab corner around to make safe.
Tape top of flashings where a Rigid Air Barrier is used.

Base flashing should not contact concrete, or use DPC to isolate if contact is unavoidable.
Fold bottom of flashing to ensure vermin-proofing.

Box flashing laps over Base.
Fasten Box flashing using a clout, wafer screw or flashing clip.
Soffit flashing laps over Box flashing.
Lap soffit flashings and tab around for complete seal.
Optional compressible foam if specified.
Ensure Cavity Closer fitted at base before installing cladding.
Do not penetrate Box flashing with fastener.
This detail is suitable for use with corrugate and trapezoidal rib profiles.
Underlays, flashing tapes and window support bars to be in place.
Coordinate with builder for adequate framing to fasten to.
Cladding and flashings to be suitably separated from any timber.
Work from factory edges first.
Primary fasteners 30mm embedment minimum into primary framing.

Fit Base flashing behind battens and underlay.
Tape top of flashings where a Rigid Air Barrier is used.

Base flashing should not contact concrete, or use DPC to isolate if contact is unavoidable.

Underflashing laps over Base.
Fasten Underflashing using a clout, wafer screw or flashing clip.
Ensure Cavity Closer fitted at base before installing cladding.
Soffit flashing laps over Underflashing.
Lap soffit flashings and tab around for complete seal.
Optional compressible foam if specified.
Do not penetrate Underflashing with fastener.
Fold bottom of flashing to ensure vermin-proofing.
Fix Overflashing to cladding with rivet.
Increase depth of Soffit and Base flashings to fit past Box Corners.
This detail is suitable for use with corrugate and trapezoidal rib profiles.
Underlays, flashing tapes and window support bars to be in place.
Coordinate with builder for adequate framing to fasten to.
Cladding and flashings to be suitably separated from any timber.
Work from factory edges first.
Primary fasteners 30mm embedment minimum into primary framing.

Fit Base flashing behind battens and underlay.
Tape top of flashings where a Rigid Air Barrier is used.

Base flashing should not contact concrete, or use DPC to isolate if contact is unavoidable.
Fold bottom of flashing to ensure vermin-proofing.

Box flashing laps over Base.
Fasten Box flashing using a clout, wafer screw or flashing clip.
Soffit flashing laps over Box flashing.
Lap soffit flashings for complete seal.
Optional compressible foam if specified.
Do not penetrate Box flashing with fastener.
This detail is suitable for use with corrugate and trapezoidal rib profiles.
Underlays, flashing tapes and window support bars to be in place.
Coordinate with builder for adequate framing to fasten to.
Cladding and flashings to be suitably separated from any timber.
Work from factory edges first.
Primary fasteners 30mm embedment minimum into primary framing.

Fit Base flashing behind battens and underlay.
Tape top of flashings where a Rigid Air Barrier is used.

Base flashing should not contact concrete, or use DPC to isolate if contact is unavoidable.

Underflashing laps over Base.
Fasten Underflashing using a clout, wafer screw or flashing clip.

Extend the Underflashing up, and fold it back to the primary framing.
Fold on site or use a two-piece flashing.
Apron from upper roof must overlap Underflashing.
Apron from upper roof finishes with diverter.
Tape top of Apron flashing to underlay or Rigid Air Barrier.
Transition flashing to outside of Underflashing and fascia.
Align with bottom of fascia.
Fit Soffit flashing so that transition flashing laps past it.
Fascia behind transition flashing.
Ensure Cavity Closer fitted at base and over Apron flashing before installing cladding.
Neatly cut slot into cladding for diverter.
Do not penetrate Underflashing with fastener.
Spouting minimum 10mm from cladding.
This detail is suitable for use with corrugate and trapezoidal rib profiles.
Underlays, flashing tapes and window support bars to be in place.
Coordinate with builder for adequate framing to fasten to.
Cladding and flashings to be suitably separated from any timber.
Work from factory edges first.
Primary fasteners 30mm embedment minimum into primary framing.

Underflashing for corner laps over Base.
Fasten Underflashing using a clout, wafer screw or flashing clip.
Trim to fit under Apron to lower roof.

Extend Underflashing up and fold to back of cavity to primary framing behind Apron upstand.
Fold on site or use a two-piece flashing.
Fit Soffit flashing hard up behind fascia.
Tape top of Apron flashing to underlay or Rigid Air Barrier.
Stopend to top of Apron flashing, with slot at bottom for Barge flashing to fit over.
Ensure Cavity Closer is fitted at base and over Apron flashing before installing cladding.
With timber barge boards, flashings and Cladding to be suitably separated from any timber.
Neatly cut slot into cladding for stopend.
Do not penetrate Underflashing with fastener.
Fix Overflashing to cladding with rivet, fold and seal top edge to cladding.
Fit Barge flashing under the slot in Apron stopend, trim to fit cladding and Overflashing.
Underlays, flashing tapes, window/door support bars to be in place - ensure these are complete as required.
This detail is suitable for use with corrugate and trapezoidal rib profiles.
Coordinate with builder for adequate framing to fasten to.
Cladding and flashings to be suitably separated from any timber.
Work from factory edges first.
Primary fasteners 30mm embedment minimum into primary framing.

Fit Underflashings, all the way from above sill of penetration, down and over Base flashing.
Fasten Underflashing using a clout, wafer screw or flashing clip.
Trim Jamb flashing to mitre over Sill.
Mitre face of Jamb flashing over Sill face.
Lap Jamb flashing over turn-up of Sill flashing.
Sill flashing must have minimum 8mm vertical cover by window extrusion, and have 5mm anti- capillary gap.
Trim Jamb flashing, to suit Head flashing which will be installed above it.
Stopend and fit Head flashing over Jamb flashings, and to outside of cavity battens.
Rivet and seal underside of Head flashing to Jamb.
Stopend Zed flashing and fit from inside of cavity, out over Head flashing to allow cavity above to drain.
Tape top of Zed flashing to underlay or Rigid Air Barrier.
Ensure Cavity Closer is fitted outside Zed flashing and at base.
Neatly cut slot into cladding for Head flashing turn-up.
Fit cladding into all flashings.
Underlays, flashing tapes, window/door support bars to be in place - ensure these are complete as required.
This detail is suitable for use with corrugate and trapezoidal rib profiles.
Coordinate with builder for adequate framing to fasten to.
Cladding and flashings to be suitably separated from any timber.
Work from factory edges first.
Primary fasteners 30mm embedment minimum into primary framing.
Cut/fold base flashing to suit finish of door opening, and finish edge to make safe.

Fit Base flashing behind battens and underlay.
Tape top of flashings where a Rigid Air Barrier is used.

Base flashing should not contact concrete, or use DPC to isolate if contact is unavoidable.
Fit Jamb flashings over base.
Trim and fold channel edge and face of Jamb flashing, to suit Head flashing which will be installed above it.
Stopend and fit Head flashing over Jamb flashings, and to outside of cavity battens.
Rivet and seal underside of Head flashing to Jamb.
Stopend Zed flashing and fit from inside of cavity, out over the door head.
Tape top of Zed flashing to underlay or Rigid Air Barrier.
Ensure Cavity Closer is fitted outside Zed flashing .
Neatly cut slot into cladding for Head flashing turn-up.
Ensure Cavity Closer is fitted at base before installing cladding.
Fit cladding into all flashings.
For round penetrations, builder to construct a rectangular support, and weatherproof the protruding pipe/flue to the face of this support.
These instructions then weatherproof the cladding to that support.
This detail is suitable for use with corrugate and trapezoidal rib profiles.
Underlays, flashing tapes and window support bars to be in place.
Coordinate with builder for adequate framing to fasten to.
Cladding and flashings to be suitably separated from any timber.
Work from factory edges first.
Primary fasteners 30mm embedment minimum into primary framing.

Fit Underflashings, all the way from above sill of penetration, down and over Base flashing.
Fasten Underflashing using a clout, wafer screw or flashing clip.
Trim Jamb flashing to mitre over Sill.
Rivet Jamb and Sill flashings to penetration.
Mitre face of Jamb flashing over face of lower flashing.
Lap Jamb flashing over turn-up of Sill flashing.
Trim and fold Jamb flashing, to suit Head flashing which will be installed above it.
Seal and rivet 30 x 30mm angle to top of penetration, and seal over face of Jamb flashings.
Fit and seal Head flashing over top Angle flashing and Jamb flashings, and to outside of cavity battens.
Rivet and seal underside of Head flashing to Jamb.
Angle flashing shown dotted beneath Head flashing.
Stopend Zed flashing and fit from inside of cavity, out over Head flashing to allow cavity above to drain.
Tape top of Zed flashing to underlay or Rigid Air Barrier.
Ensure Cavity Closer is fitted outside Zed flashing and at base.
Neatly cut slot into cladding for Head flashing turn-up.
Fit cladding into all flashings.
This detail is suitable for use with corrugate and trapezoidal rib profiles.
Underlays, flashing tapes and window support bars to be in place.
Coordinate with builder for adequate framing to fasten to.
Cladding and flashings to be suitably separated from any timber.
Work from factory edges first.
Primary fasteners 30mm embedment minimum into primary framing.
Garage door jamb and head are painted, and extend at least as far as face of cladding.

Fit Base flashing behind battens and underlay, across to edge of garage door jamb.
Tape top of flashings where a Rigid Air Barrier is used.

Base flashing should not contact concrete, or use DPC to isolate if contact is unavoidable.
Fit Jamb flashings over base.

If no cladding over garage door:
Finish Jamb flashing up to soffit, then Skip to Stage 5.

If cladding continues over garage door:
Trim and fold Jamb flashing, to suit Head flashing which will be installed above it.
Stopend and fit Head flashing over Jamb flashings, and to outside of cavity battens.
Rivet and seal underside of Head flashing to Jamb.
Stopend Zed flashing and fit from inside of cavity, out over Head flashing to allow cavity above to drain.
Tape top of Zed flashing to underlay or Rigid Air Barrier.
Ensure Cavity Closer is fitted outside Zed flashing.
Ensure Cavity  Closer fitted at  base before  installing cladding.
Neatly cut slot into cladding for Head flashing turn-up.
Fit cladding into all flashings.
Fit Jamb Cover flashing if required.
This detail is suitable for use with corrugate and trapezoidal rib profiles.
Underlays, flashing tapes and window support bars to be in place.
Coordinate with builder for adequate framing to fasten to.
Cladding and flashings to be suitably separated from any timber.
Work from factory edges first.
Primary fasteners 30mm embedment minimum into primary framing.
Ensure suitable framing for Inter-storey flashing.
Fit Inter-storey flashing behind upper storey battens.
Trim upstand of Inter-storey flashing around each cantilevered joist - maintain upstand minimum 15mm.
Lap upper storey underlay over flashing, or tape top of flashing to underlay or Rigid Air Barrier.
Fit Saddle flashing over each joist - hem to three edges.
Tape over edges of Saddle flashing to underlay.
Ensure Cavity Closer is fitted over Inter-storey flashing.
Continue upper-storey flashings and cladding as required.
Trim upper cladding with 5mm gap to Saddle flashing.
This detail is suitable for use with corrugate and trapezoidal rib profiles.
Underlays, flashing tapes and window support bars to be in place.
Coordinate with builder for adequate framing to fasten to.
Cladding and flashings to be suitably separated from any timber.
Work from factory edges first.
Primary fasteners 30mm embedment minimum into primary framing.
Install flashings to lower storey (external corner example).
All vertical flashings must come up and lap beneath Inter-storey flashing.
Fit Inter-storey flashing from back of cavity, out over line of lower storey cladding.
Lap upper storey underlay over flashing, or tape top of flashing to underlay or Rigid Air Barrier.

actions.layers: Layer:Cladding story1_8,Layer:Cladding story1_2,Layer:Cladding story1_3,Layer:Cladding story1_1,Layer:Cladding story1_0,Layer:Cladding_top_0

labels.text: Ensure Cavity Closer fitted over Inter-storey flashing.
Continue upper-storey flashings and cladding as required.
Finish and seal Inter-storey flashing to lower storey flashings.

actions.layers: !Layer:Cladding_1,Layer:Cladding_0,Layer:Compressible Foam_0,Layer:Compressible Foam_1,Layer:Compressible Foam_7,Layer:Compressible Foam_a_1,Layer:Compressible Foam_6,Layer:Compressible Foam_5

labels.text: Increase depth of Soffit and Base flashings to fit past Expansion flashing.
This detail is suitable for use with corrugate and trapezoidal rib profiles.
Underlays, flashing tapes and window support bars to be in place.
Coordinate with builder for adequate framing to fasten to.
Cladding and flashings to be suitably separated from any timber.
Work from factory edges first.
Primary fasteners 30mm embedment minimum into primary framing.
Ensure necessary framing for primary fasteners.

Fit Base flashing or Inter-storey flashing behind battens and underlay.
Tape top of flashings where a Rigid Air Barrier is used.

Base flashing should not contact concrete, or use DPC to isolate if contact is unavoidable.
Fold bottom of Expansion flashing to ensure vermin-proofing.
Fit Expansion flashing over lower flashing.
Soffit flashing laps over Expansion flashing.
